## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install mytestrepo in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure mytestrepo package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to mytestrepo
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/akrishnamo/mytestrepo):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/akrishnamo/mytestrepo.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/akrishnamo/mytestrepo)

``` sh
$ conda install -c akrishnamo mytestrepo
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/mytestrepo/)

``` sh
$ pip install mytestrepo
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/akrishnamo/mytestrepo)’s
[pages](https://akrishnamo.github.io/mytestrepo/). Additionally you can
find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/akrishnamo/mytestrepo) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/mytestrepo/) respectively.
